meanings.sent1: I only have a tuzz of sugar left for my coffee.
meanings.sent2: She found a tuzz of sand in her shoe after the beach.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant carried a tuzz of food back to its nest.
meanings.sent4: His contribution was just a tuzz in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent5: The lone star twinkled like a tuzz in the vast night sky.

meanings.definition: Tuzz (verb): To move quickly and erratically.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel would tuzz around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The children tuzzed through the playground, full of energy.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would tuzz after its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The leaves tuzzed in the wind, dancing across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The car would tuzz down the winding road, swerving left and right.

meanings.sent1: Her tuzz hair stuck out in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The room was tuzz with papers scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The tuzz closet was a jumble of clothes and shoes.
meanings.sent4: The garden looked tuzz after the storm had passed.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen was a tuzz of pots and pans after the big dinner.
